comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Always one for the "see also," I thought I'd point to the San Xavier Mission web site, which also has a great "History" page, for anyone who wanted to know more about this beautiful place. And then, as luck would have it, when I got my Google results and starting comparing pictures and locations, I realized that the San Xavier Mission, identified on the glass negative as being in California, is actually just outside of Tucson -- in Arizona! [http://www.flickr.com/photos/vieilles_annonces/1606643746/] Unless there are two shockingly similar missions, with the same name, it's time to change the title of this photo. Or blame the person who typed the label and stuck it on the glass negative 80 years ago? But a comment from us wouldn't be a comment without links... Check out the book "Mission San Xavier del Bac: A Guide to Its Iconography" Want to learn A LOT about Mission San Xavier and see more great pictures? Read the Wikipedia article . Want to do some research> Check out Marquette University's Guide to Catholic-Related Records in the West about Native Americans
